attributes.additional_details:
After previously banning beheading videos, Facebook has decided to allow them on their website again ('Facebook lets beheading clips return to social network, BBC News, 22/10/2013, http://www.bbc.co.uk/news/technology-24608499).
These videos will be able to be seen by children aged 13 and above. If UK citizens aren't allowed to buy videos containing a similar level of (fake) bloody violence until they are 18, Facebook has a duty to prevent people seeing graphic violent videos of real life murders and crimes on their website. They are glorifying violence.

rejection.details: Facebook is responsible for its content, and has withdrawn such videos.
